new_joiner_rule.description: 회사에 처음 들어온 사람은 1개월간 일반 스텝(staff) 트레이닝을 받는다. 리더 직군이라도 동일.

items.team_signal: 우리는 환자 경험을 중요하게 여기는 팀인가?

닥터가 스케줄 문제로 짜증.
환자가 예상보다 높은 금액에 항의.
같은 시간에 환자 두 명 예약.
SSO가 필요한 서류 요청.
환자 치료 만족.
동료가 반복 지각.
환자가 다른 환자 정보를 묻는다.
체어 장비 일시 고장.
환자가 "다음에 낼게요."
신규 환자 긴장 상태.
본인이 예약 입력 실수.
치료 15분 지연.
보험 클레임 거절.
동료가 회의 중 공개 불만.
과다 청구 발견.
1시간 예약 공백.
SSO 이메일 톤이 딱딱하게 느껴짐.
환자가 재예약 없이 나감.

items_en.situation: A patient arrives 20 minutes late and insists on being seen immediately.

options.label: Explain that the schedule is full and offer the next available time.
Apologize and force the assistant to squeeze them in.
Tell the patient they are late and must reschedule.

immediate_outcome.B: Creates stress in the back office.

items_en.team_signal: How we handle lateness defines fairness standards.

items_en.situation: An assistant forgot to restock a room before your shift.

options.label: Fix it quietly and move on.
Tell the OM the previous assistant was careless.

items_en.team_signal: Do we solve or assign blame?

items_en.situation: A patient questions the treatment cost at checkout.

options.label: Calmly review the treatment plan and insurance breakdown.
Say that billing is not your responsibility.

items_en.situation: A doctor asks for an instrument that is not prepared.

options.label: Explain it was not on the setup list.

items_en.situation: A patient leaves a mildly negative review online.

options.label: Inform the OM and document details.

items_en.situation: You notice a small scheduling overlap.

options.label: Alert the assistant and adjust timing.

items_en.situation: A patient is visibly anxious before treatment.
The phone is ringing while a patient waits to check out.

options.label: Finish helping the in-person patient first.

items_en.situation: You discover a minor charting error.
A coworker appears overwhelmed during a busy block.

options.label: Focus only on your own tasks.

items_en.situation: A patient requests a same-day appointment that is not available.

options.label: Offer next available slot and waitlist option.

items_en.situation: You are unsure about a sterilization step.
A patient complains about waiting 10 minutes.
You forgot to log a supply order.

options.label: Wait to see if anyone notices.

items_en.situation: A patient seems confused about post-op instructions.
A coworker makes a small mistake in front of a patient.

options.label: Support calmly and correct privately later.

items_en.situation: You are asked to stay 15 minutes late unexpectedly.

options.label: Clarify need and assist if possible.

items_en.situation: A patient asks for clinical advice outside your scope.
You feel frustrated after a busy morning.

options.label: Take a short reset and refocus.

items_en.situation: A patient forgets their insurance card.

items.situation: 최근 2주간 보험 verification이 지연되어 체크인 시간이 평균 10분 증가.
items.culture_signal: 우리는 문제를 비난으로 해결하는가, 기록과 개선으로 해결하는가?

items.title: AR 증가
items.situation: 미수금 증가로 환자 후속 연락이 늘어남.

options.label: 정책 재설명 후 유연한 플랜 제안

items.culture_signal: 우리는 단기 압박 중심인가, 관계 유지 중심인가?

items.situation: 예약 후 미방문 환자 증가.

items.situation: 예약 과밀로 대기 시간 증가.

items.situation: 필수 파일 업로드 누락으로 클레임 지연.

items.title: 리뷰 감소
items.situation: 리뷰 수 감소.

items.title: 치료 지연 설명 부족
items.situation: 치료 지연 설명 없이 진행.

items.situation: 같은 보험 거절 반복 발생.

items.situation: 환자가 결제 플랜 조건 오해.

items_en.situation: Insurance verification has been delayed repeatedly, and check-in is backing up during the morning rush.
items_en.stakeholder: Front Desk / SSO / Office Manager / Patients

options.label: Stay neutral with patients, document delays in a simple log, and escalate with examples to the OM.
Create a manual workaround for verification on the spot without documenting.
Email SSO with a frustrated tone and demand immediate fixes.

first_order.A: Patient experience stabilizes and data is created for process improvement.
first_order.B: Short-term flow improves but risk of errors and missing documentation increases.
first_order.C: May trigger a quick response but increases relationship tension.

items_en.culture_signal: We fix problems with facts and systems, not blame.

items_en.situation: No-show rates increased, and the schedule has multiple gaps each week.

options.label: Increase confirmation touches (text + call) for high-risk appointments and track outcomes.
Introduce a strict no-show fee immediately for all patients.
Do nothing and accept gaps as normal.

first_order.A: Reduces no-shows gradually and builds a repeatable process.
first_order.B: May reduce no-shows but increases complaints and review risk.

items_en.situation: Accounts receivable follow-up calls are increasing and patients are getting upset about balances.

options.label: Use a consistent script: clarify balance, offer payment options, confirm timeline, and document the call.
Use a firm tone to push full payment immediately.
Avoid AR calls and wait for patients to pay later.

first_order.A: Improves collections while protecting patient relationships.
first_order.B: Short-term collections may improve but complaints increase.
first_order.C: Cashflow worsens and workload stacks up.

items_en.culture_signal: Clear, respectful communication protects both revenue and trust.

items_en.situation: Case acceptance is dropping because patients say they don't understand why treatment is needed.

options.label: Use a simple explanation template: problem → consequence → options, then confirm understanding.
Focus mainly on price discounts to persuade.
Redirect all questions to the OM to avoid taking time.

first_order.A: Patient clarity increases and acceptance improves over time.
first_order.B: May increase acceptance temporarily but shifts the relationship to price.
first_order.C: Reduces immediate load but acceptance drops further.

items_en.culture_signal: We lead with education, not pressure.

items_en.situation: SSO emails feel blunt, and local staff are starting to disengage from collaboration.
items_en.kpi: Processing speed stable, but internal rework feels higher

options.label: Reply with a neutral template: request → deadline → required documents, and ask for clarification when needed.
Ignore the tone and do things the local way without alignment.
Call out the tone publicly in a group message.

first_order.A: Reduces friction and keeps communication clear.
first_order.B: Short-term autonomy increases but mistakes and rework rise.

items_en.culture_signal: We manage cross-cultural collaboration with structure, not emotion.

items_en.situation: Patients are waiting longer than usual due to overbooking, and the front desk is getting complaints.
items_en.stakeholder: Front Desk / Assistants / Patients / Office Manager

options.label: Flag recurring delays by time block and propose a short trial adjustment to the OM.
Keep overbooking and ask the back office to move faster.
Stop all overbooking immediately without aligning with the OM.

first_order.A: Creates a practical path to reduce waits while protecting production.
first_order.B: Maintains production but increases stress and mistakes.
first_order.C: Wait time improves but production drops suddenly.

items_en.culture_signal: We balance experience and production with testable adjustments.

items_en.situation: Claim submission errors increased, leading to denials and extra work.

options.label: Implement a simple QA checkpoint for high-risk claims and share a weekly error summary.
Ask SSO to fix everything without changing internal process.
Continue submitting as-is to avoid slowing down.

first_order.A: Error rate improves and rework decreases over time.
first_order.B: May improve temporarily but root cause persists.
first_order.C: Denials grow and revenue is delayed.

items_en.culture_signal: Quality is a system, not a person.

items_en.situation: A patient claims they were overcharged and demands a refund at the front desk.

options.label: Stay calm, review the ledger, explain clearly, and escalate to OM if needed with documentation.
Refund immediately to end the conflict.
Argue and insist the patient is wrong.

first_order.A: Protects trust and ensures accurate resolution.
first_order.B: Stops the conflict quickly but may create repeat behavior and revenue loss.

items_en.situation: Reappointment rates are dropping because patients leave without scheduling the next step.

options.label: Standardize a handoff: assistant confirms next step, then walks patient to front to schedule.
Leave reappointment entirely to the front desk only.
Send a text later and hope they schedule.

first_order.B: Some patients slip through during busy times.
first_order.C: Conversion stays low and follow-up workload increases.

items_en.situation: Two assistants are frustrated about uneven room turnover duties.

options.label: Have a calm 1:1, clarify task expectations, and propose a fair rotation to the lead/OM.
Argue publicly to prove a point.
Stop helping and do only your minimum tasks.

first_order.B: Escalates conflict and hurts patient experience indirectly.

items_en.culture_signal: We solve workload fairness with clarity, not conflict.

items_en.situation: SSO reports that required documents are missing, causing claim delays.

options.label: Confirm the exact missing items, update the upload checklist, and track repeat misses.
Blame SSO and insist they should figure it out.
Ignore it and hope it resolves.

first_order.A: Reduces repeat misses and builds a stable workflow.

items_en.culture_signal: We improve the system at the point of failure.

items_en.situation: Monthly Google reviews dropped sharply even though patient volume is stable.

options.label: Reintroduce a simple review ask at checkout and track asks vs. results.
Offer discounts in exchange for reviews.

first_order.A: Review volume improves without policy risk.
first_order.B: Creates ethical and platform compliance risk.

items_en.culture_signal: We grow reputation with consistent service habits.

items_en.situation: A treatment is running late, but no one updated the waiting patient.

options.label: Notify the front desk with a realistic time estimate and offer the patient options.
Blame the schedule and say nothing.

items_en.situation: The same insurance denial reason keeps happening across multiple claims.

options.label: Identify the pattern, document examples, and request a process adjustment with SSO/OM.
Tell patients it's their insurance problem.

first_order.A: Improves future approvals and reduces rework.
first_order.B: Patient trust drops and complaints rise.

items_en.culture_signal: We fix patterns, not just incidents.

items_en.situation: A patient misunderstands the payment plan terms and is now past due.

options.label: Re-explain key terms (amount, due dates, autopay), document, and set a clear next step.
Apply the policy strictly without explanation.
Avoid the conversation to reduce conflict.

first_order.A: Improves clarity and increases chance of collection.
first_order.B: Increases complaint risk and relationship damage.

items_en.culture_signal: Clarity prevents conflict and protects cashflow.

items.title: SSO 지연 + 현장 불만 누적
items.situation: 보험 verification 지연이 반복되며 현장에서는 '우리만 욕먹는다'는 분위기가 형성됨.
items.kpi_data: 체크인 지연 평균 12분 / No-show 7%→10% / 당일 수금 감소 체감
items.constraint: SSO 계약 3개월 남음 / 현장 인력 추가 채용은 당장 불가
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 환자 응대 부담↑ / OM: 성과 압박↑ / SSO: 자료 누락 불만 / 환자: 대기 불만

options.label: 환자 앞에서는 중립 설명 + 내부적으로 지연 로그 표준화
현장에서 즉시 우회 처리(임시 수기 프로세스)
SSO에 강한 톤으로 즉시 개선 요구

items.short_term: A 환자 경험 안정, 데이터 확보 / B 당장 현장 숨통, 오류 위험↑ / C 단기 반응 가능, 관계 악화
items.long_term: A 원인 분석·개선 가능 / B 임시가 고착되면 품질/컴플라이언스 위험 / C blame 문화 확산 가능

items.title: AR 콜 갈등
items.situation: 미수금 콜을 두고 '너무 공격적' vs '너무 약하다'로 내부 의견 충돌.
items.constraint: 환자 불만 민감 / 스크립트는 표준화되어 있지 않음
items.stakeholder_map: Admin: 수금 압박 / 환자: 비용 스트레스 / OM: 리뷰 리스크 / SSO: 후속 처리량↑
items.short_term: A 불만 관리+수금 개선 가능 / B 단기 수금↑, 불만↑ / C 업무 감소, 수금↓
items.long_term: A 지속 가능한 관계형 수금 문화 / B 리뷰·이탈로 장기 손실 / C 현금흐름 약화로 운영 압박

items.title: 대기시간 증가와 팀 마찰
items.situation: 오버북이 누적되며 대기시간이 길어지고, Front-Back 팀이 서로 탓하기 시작.
items.constraint: 닥터 진료 속도는 단기간 개선 어려움 / 예약 규칙이 오피스마다 다름
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 스케줄 방어 / Assistant: 체어턴 부담 / 환자: 불만 / 닥터: 스트레스

options.label: 현 상태 유지하며 불만은 현장에서 처리

items.short_term: A 생산 일부 유지+대기 개선 검증 / B 대기 개선, 생산↓ / C 생산 유지, 불만↑
items.long_term: A 규칙 기반 운영 문화 / B 보수적 운영 고착 가능 / C blame 문화·이직 위험

items.title: 치료 동의율 하락(설명 구조 문제)
items.situation: 환자들이 '왜 필요한지 모르겠다'며 치료를 미루는 사례 증가.
items.constraint: 가격 할인은 제한적 / TC 시간이 부족
items.stakeholder_map: TC: 설명 시간 부족 / 닥터: 치료 필요성 전달 / 환자: 비용·이해 부족 / Front: 일정 영향
items.short_term: A 이해 상승 기대 / B 단기 반응, 신뢰↓ 가능 / C 시간 절약, 전환↓
items.long_term: A 교육형 문화 / B 가격 경쟁 프레임 강화 / C 책임 회피 문화

items.title: SSO 커뮤니케이션 오해가 성과에 번짐
items.situation: SSO의 딱딱한 이메일 톤이 반복되며 현장에서는 협조 의지가 떨어짐.
items.kpi_data: 처리 속도 정상이나 '응답 지연' 체감 증가
items.constraint: 시차로 실시간 조율 어려움 / 번역·표현 차이
items.stakeholder_map: Admin: 감정 소진 / SSO: 규정 준수 강조 / OM: 갈등 중재 / 환자: 간접 영향
items.short_term: A 충돌 감소 / B 단기 편의, 누락↑ / C 단기 통쾌, 관계 악화
items.long_term: A 프로세스 중심 문화 / B 오류 누적 / C 글로벌 협업 붕괴 위험

items.title: 리뷰 대응 일관성 부족
items.situation: 부정 리뷰가 생길 때마다 대응 방식이 달라 내부 혼란.
items.constraint: 개인정보 노출 금지(HIPAA) / 공개 댓글은 신중 필요
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 응대 1차 / OM: 승인 / 마케팅: 문구 / 환자: 감정
items.short_term: A 리스크 낮고 일관성↑ / B 감정 싸움 가능 / C 평판 방치
items.long_term: A 브랜드 관리 문화 / B 조직 이미지 악화 / C 장기 평판 손실

items.title: 결제 플랜 오해로 연체 증가
items.situation: 결제 플랜 조건을 오해한 환자들이 연체하며 항의.
items.constraint: 정책은 복잡하고 설명 시간이 짧음
items.stakeholder_map: Admin: 설명 부담 / 환자: 불신 / OM: 컴플레인 처리 / SSO: 후속
items.short_term: A 오해 감소 / B 단기 만족, 연체↑ / C 불만↑
items.long_term: A 투명·일관 문화 / B 규정 붕괴 / C 관계 악화

items.title: 체어사이드 인수인계 누락
items.situation: 닥터-어시스턴트 인수인계가 빠져서 준비 누락이 반복됨.
items.kpi_data: 케이스 준비 누락 주 1→주 4 / 지연 발생
items.constraint: 스케줄이 타이트 / 체크리스트 미정착
items.stakeholder_map: Assistant: 준비 부담 / 닥터: 시간 압박 / 환자: 대기 / Front: 일정 재조정
items.short_term: A 지연 감소 / B 반복 / C 불만
items.long_term: A 시스템 기반 협업 문화 / B 개인 탓 문화 / C 신뢰 하락

items.title: 재예약률 하락(스크립트/타이밍 문제)
items.situation: 환자들이 치료 후 재예약 없이 떠나는 경우 증가.
items.constraint: 대기열이 길고 프론트가 바쁨
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 업무 과부하 / Assistant: 환자 흐름 / 환자: 피로 / OM: 생산성
items.short_term: A 즉시 전환↑ / B 누락↑ / C 전환 낮음
items.long_term: A 과정 중심 문화 / B 개인 역량 의존 / C 회수 어려움

items.title: 신규 환자 온보딩 불일치
items.situation: 신규 환자 안내가 직원마다 달라 불만이 생김.
items.constraint: 표준 스크립트 없음 / 피크타임 인력 부족
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 안내 / Assistant: 이동 / 환자: 불안 / OM: 표준화 필요
items.short_term: A 혼란 감소 / B 불만↑ / C 편차 지속
items.long_term: A 일관성 문화 / B 환자경험 약화 / C 교육 어려움

items.title: SSO 업로드 누락으로 클레임 지연
items.situation: 필수 서류 업로드 누락으로 클레임이 지연되고, 서로 책임 공방.
items.constraint: 파일 규칙이 복잡 / 누가 최종 확인자인지 불명확
items.stakeholder_map: Admin: 업로드 / SSO: 제출 / RCM: 결과 / OM: 중재
items.short_term: A 누락 감소 / B 반복 / C 분위기 악화
items.long_term: A 책임 명확화 문화 / B 시스템 불안정 / C 두려움 문화

items.title: 재고/소모품 부족으로 진료 지연
items.situation: 소모품 재고 부족으로 케이스가 지연되고 닥터가 불만.
items.constraint: 공급 리드타임 / 예산 제한
items.stakeholder_map: Assistant: 재고 관리 / 닥터: 일정 / OM: 예산 / 환자: 대기
items.short_term: A 안정 / B 긴급비용↑ / C 임시 해결
items.long_term: A 예방 문화 / B 비효율 고착 / C 조직 피로

items.title: 환자 문의 전화 폭주
items.situation: 특정 주에 문의 전화가 폭주해 응대가 밀림.
items.kpi_data: 응답 지연 평균 2분→7분 / 콜백 누락 증가
items.constraint: 인력 추가 어려움 / SSO 콜센터 옵션 검토 중
items.stakeholder_map: Front: 과부하 / 환자: 불만 / OM: 프로세스 / SSO: 지원 가능
items.short_term: A 누락↓ / B 누락↑ / C 불만↑
items.long_term: A 시스템 운영 문화 / B 번아웃 / C 브랜드 손상

items.title: 치료 지연 안내 부족으로 컴플레인
items.situation: 치료가 지연되었는데 안내가 부족해 컴플레인이 발생.
items.constraint: HIPAA 준수 / 다른 환자 사유 언급 불가
items.stakeholder_map: Assistant: 안내 / Front: 대기관리 / 환자: 불만 / OM: 리뷰 위험
items.short_term: A 불만 감소 / B 불만 유지 / C 리뷰 위험
items.long_term: A 투명 문화 / B 소극 대응 / C 불신 문화

items.title: 팀 내 피드백 방식 충돌
items.situation: 업무 피드백이 공개적으로 이루어져 감정 상처가 반복.
items.kpi_data: 팀 만족도 하락 / 이직 의사 표현 1건
items.constraint: 바쁜 환경 / 즉시 수정 필요 상황 존재
items.stakeholder_map: Lead Assistant: 성과 압박 / Staff: 위축 / OM: 문화 / 환자: 간접 영향
items.short_term: A 분위기 안정 / B 긴장↑ / C 품질↓
items.long_term: A 심리적 안전+품질 균형 / B 두려움 문화 / C 기준 붕괴

items_en.situation: Over the last month, the office has frequent morning backups at check-in because insurance verification is not ready by arrival time.
items_en.kpi_data: Avg check-in delay: 6 min → 14 min; Patient complaints: 1 → 6/month
items_en.constraint: No additional front desk hours this quarter; SSO turnaround depends on offshore shift schedule

options.label: Start a 2-week log of delayed verifications (date, payer, appointment type), propose a 'verification cutoff time' and a backup script for patients.
Build a local workaround by calling payers same-day without tracking patterns.
Escalate emotionally to SSO leadership and demand immediate change.

short_term.A: Creates clarity and reduces patient friction with consistent messaging.
short_term.B: May reduce some delays but increases staff workload and error risk.
short_term.C: May trigger attention but increases tension and defensive behavior.

items_en.long_term: A builds a repeatable system and cross-team trust; B creates fragile hero-work; C reinforces blame culture and communication breakdown.

items_en.situation: Case acceptance for higher-value treatment has declined, and doctors believe patients 'only care about price.'
items_en.kpi_data: Case acceptance: 62% → 48%; Treatment plan value unchanged
items_en.constraint: Doctors have limited chairside time; no new marketing budget
items_en.stakeholder_map: Doctors / Assistants / Treatment Coordinator / Patients / OM

options.label: Standardize a 3-step explanation flow (problem → consequence → options) and add a 1-minute 'teach-back' confirmation before checkout.
Push discounts more aggressively to close cases.
Stop presenting complex options and only offer minimal treatment.

short_term.A: Improves patient understanding with minimal time cost.
short_term.B: May increase acceptance short-term but erodes margin and trust.
short_term.C: Reduces discussion time but decreases revenue and outcomes.

items_en.long_term: A builds a durable communication system; B creates price-first culture; C lowers clinical standards and future growth.

items_en.situation: No-show rates are uneven by appointment type, causing production instability.
items_en.kpi_data: No-show overall: 9%; Hygiene: 6%; New patient: 14%; Major treatment consults: 18%
items_en.constraint: Cannot add more confirmation staff time; cannot overbook hygiene heavily
items_en.stakeholder_map: Front Desk / Patients / Hygiene / Doctors / OM

options.label: Tag high-risk appointment types and apply targeted confirmation (text + call only for consults/new patients), then review after 4 weeks.
Apply a strict fee policy to all appointment types immediately.
Overbook all categories equally to 'protect production.'

short_term.A: Reduces the highest-risk no-shows without overwhelming staff.
short_term.B: May reduce no-shows but increases conflict and review risk.
short_term.C: May fill gaps but increases wait time and staff stress.

items_en.long_term: A creates a measured system; B creates enforcement culture; C creates burnout and patient dissatisfaction.

items_en.situation: Claims are being denied due to missing documentation, creating recurring rework between the office and SSO.
items_en.constraint: Upload process varies by staff; no extra admin headcount
items_en.stakeholder_map: Admin / SSO / RCM / OM / Doctors (notes) / Assistants (attachments)

options.label: Create a single 'required upload checklist' per claim type and assign one final checkpoint owner per day.
Tell SSO to 'double check everything' before submitting.
Keep the current workflow and accept resubmissions as normal.

short_term.A: Reduces misses quickly and clarifies responsibility.
short_term.B: Creates friction and slows processing without fixing root cause.

items_en.long_term: A builds reliability and trust; B creates blame loops; C normalizes waste and delays cashflow.

items_en.situation: Wait times increased after a schedule template change, but the team is unclear what exactly caused it.
items_en.kpi_data: Avg wait time: 18 min → 41 min; Same-day cancellations: +22%
items_en.constraint: Template cannot be fully reverted due to production targets; limited meeting time
items_en.stakeholder_map: Front Desk / Assistants / Doctors / Patients / OM

options.label: Run a 2-week time-block review (start times, room turnover, doctor availability) and propose one targeted template adjustment.
Tell assistants to 'turn rooms faster' without changing the template.

short_term.A: Identifies the true bottleneck and reduces chaos.
short_term.B: Increases stress and errors with minimal improvement.
short_term.C: Improves waits but reduces production sharply.

items_en.long_term: A strengthens continuous improvement; B creates burnout culture; C creates fear of change and reactive planning.

items_en.situation: Reappointment rates are down because patients leave without scheduling, especially after busy afternoons.
items_en.constraint: Front desk is often solo staffed after 3pm; phones are heavy
items_en.stakeholder_map: Assistants / Front Desk / Patients / OM / Doctors

options.label: Implement a consistent clinical-to-front handoff: assistant confirms next step + urgency, then warm-handoff to scheduling.
Rely only on automated texts to bring patients back.
Ask doctors to personally schedule every patient.

short_term.A: Improves capture without major staffing changes.
short_term.B: Saves time but conversion stays low.
short_term.C: Adds burden and slows clinical flow.

items_en.long_term: A builds team ownership; B normalizes leakage; C creates frustration and inefficiency.

items_en.situation: AR follow-up is inconsistent, and patients report receiving different answers from different staff.
items_en.constraint: Policy cannot be changed this quarter; staff turnover recently increased
items_en.stakeholder_map: Admin / Front Desk / Patients / OM / SSO (posting)

options.label: Standardize a 3-point billing explanation (balance, due date, options) and require a note template for each contact.
Let each staff member handle billing in their own style.
Stop calling and only send statements.

items_en.long_term: A creates consistent patient experience; B creates randomness and distrust; C creates chronic AR inflation.

items_en.situation: Room turnover is slow, and the back office feels the schedule is 'impossible,' while front office says 'we have to hit production.'
items_en.kpi_data: Room turnover avg: 9 min → 15 min; End-of-day delays: +30–45 min daily
items_en.constraint: No additional assistants this quarter; sterilization capacity fixed
items_en.stakeholder_map: Assistants / Sterilization / Front Desk / Doctors / OM

options.label: Map the turnover steps, remove one bottleneck (tray prep timing, instrument routing), and trial for 2 weeks.
Ask everyone to work faster with no process changes.
Reduce the schedule volume without OM alignment.

short_term.A: Improves flow with a specific change.
short_term.C: Immediate relief but production conflict grows.

items_en.long_term: A builds a systems mindset; B creates burnout; C creates mistrust between teams.

items_en.situation: Supply shortages are causing case delays, and emergency ordering is becoming common.
items_en.constraint: Budget is capped; vendor lead times vary

options.label: Set minimum par levels for top 20 critical items and assign a weekly 15-minute inventory check.
Continue ordering only when something runs out.
Borrow supplies from other offices repeatedly.

short_term.B: Avoids setup time but delays continue.

items_en.long_term: A creates prevention culture; B normalizes crisis mode; C drains relationships and adds hidden costs.

items_en.situation: Patients report inconsistent post-op instructions depending on which assistant they had.
items_en.kpi_data: Post-op call-backs/week: 3 → 8; Minor complications: trending up
items_en.constraint: Doctors cannot add chair time; multiple assistants rotate rooms

options.label: Create a standard post-op script + printed checklist and require teach-back confirmation.
Let each assistant explain in their own words.
Tell patients to read the paper later without explanation.

items_en.long_term: A builds consistency and safety; B creates variability and risk; C damages trust and outcomes.

items_en.situation: A recurring denial reason is causing rework, but staff are unsure whether the issue is clinical notes or coding.
items_en.kpi_data: Denials with same code reason: 10 cases/month; Resubmission time: 3–7 days
items_en.constraint: Limited access to payer details; SSO handles most submissions

options.label: Collect 5 sample cases, identify the shared missing element, and propose a single note template update or attachment rule.
Resubmit repeatedly without analyzing the pattern.
Tell patients denials are unavoidable and move on.

short_term.A: Creates actionable clarity with minimal effort.
short_term.B: Keeps work moving but waste continues.

items_en.long_term: A reduces structural waste; B normalizes rework; C harms reputation and collections.

items_en.situation: Hygiene production is stable, but doctor production is down because consult-to-treatment conversion is slipping.
items_en.constraint: No new marketing; consult slots limited
items_en.stakeholder_map: Doctors / Assistants / Front Desk / Treatment Coordinator / OM

options.label: Standardize consult workflow: pre-education, intra-visit summary, same-day scheduling attempt, and follow-up cadence.
Increase consult volume by overbooking consults.
Assume market conditions and accept lower production.

short_term.B: Increases volume but reduces quality and wait times.
short_term.C: Less disruption but revenue decline continues.

items_en.long_term: A builds a scalable conversion system; B creates chaos and patient dissatisfaction; C weakens growth mindset.

items_en.situation: Internal friction with SSO is increasing because the office feels 'they don't understand the front line,' while SSO feels 'the office doesn't follow rules.'
items_en.constraint: Time zone limits meetings; both sides already overloaded

options.label: Propose a weekly 20-minute standup with 2 metrics + 1 top issue + clear owners, and keep a shared issue tracker.
Escalate every issue individually to leadership.
Stop engaging and do things locally.

short_term.B: Gets attention but increases fatigue and defensiveness.
short_term.C: Feels faster but increases errors and conflict later.

items_en.long_term: A builds governance rhythm; B creates escalation culture; C creates fragmentation and risk.

items_en.situation: End-of-day closeout errors keep causing next-day confusion, but the checklist is long and compliance is inconsistent.
items_en.constraint: Overtime needs to be minimized; checklist currently 25 items

options.label: Reduce checklist to the top 8 critical items, assign a daily owner, and audit once per week.
Keep the full checklist and remind everyone to 'be more careful.'
Hold one person responsible for all misses without changing the process.

short_term.A: Improves compliance quickly with less friction.
short_term.B: Misses continue because behavior doesn't change.

items_en.long_term: A creates sustainable standardization; B normalizes inconsistency; C creates blame culture and hidden errors.

items_en.situation: A rise in short-notice cancellations is creating unpredictable production swings, and the team feels like they are always in 'catch-up mode.'
items_en.constraint: No additional marketing; staff time for outbound calls is limited

options.label: Build a 'short-notice fill list' (by availability + treatment type), assign 15 minutes daily for outreach, and track fill outcomes for 4 weeks.
Offer steep discounts to fill same-day openings.
Accept cancellations and end the day early.

short_term.A: Improves fill rate gradually and creates a repeatable rhythm.
short_term.B: Fills openings but trains patients to wait for discounts.
short_term.C: Reduces stress but revenue loss increases.

items_en.long_term: A builds proactive operating habits; B damages pricing integrity; C creates complacency and weakens performance culture.

items.title: SSO 지연 문제를 '사실'로 고정하기
items.situation: 특정 오피스에서 보험 verification 지연으로 체크인이 자주 밀리고, OM과 SSO가 서로를 탓하는 상황.
items.constraint: 계약 변경은 당장 불가 / 현장 추가 채용도 이번 분기 불가
items.stakeholder: OM / Front / SSO 팀 리드 / 파트너(또는 Regional)

options.label: 지연 로그(날짜·환자유형·원인) 2주 수집 후 SLA 재협의
SSO 팀에 강경 경고 메일 발송

items.first_order: A 감정이 줄고 데이터가 쌓임 / B 단기 운영 숨통, 오류·누락 위험 / C 단기 긴장 해소처럼 보이나 관계 악화
items.second_order: A 재발 방지 구조 가능 / B 임시방편 고착 시 품질·컴플라이언스 리스크 / C blame 문화 강화
items.identity_signal: 리더는 ‘누구 탓’이 아니라 ‘무슨 현상’으로 문제를 정의한다.

items.title: Associate 생산성 저하: 코칭 vs PIP
items.situation: Associate 생산성이 목표 대비 75%이고 팀은 좋아하지만 일정이 자주 밀린다.
items.constraint: 계약 6개월 남음 / 환자 만족도는 평균 이상
items.first_order: A 관계 유지, 개선 속도는 변수 / B 단기 긴장·방어 / C 원인 분리 가능
items.second_order: A 성장 문화 강화 / B 이직·팀 위축 가능 / C 형평성 논쟁 가능
items.identity_signal: 리더는 ‘사람을 살리되 기준을 흐리지 않는다’는 신호를 준다.

items.title: 대기시간 급증: 오버북 규칙 재설계
items.situation: 오버북이 누적되며 평균 대기시간이 20분에서 45분으로 상승하고 컴플레인이 늘었다.
items.constraint: 닥터 진료 속도 단기간 개선 어려움 / 광고 캠페인은 이미 집행 중

options.label: 현 상태 유지 + 현장 사과로 처리

items.first_order: A 생산 일부 유지+대기 개선 검증 / B 대기 개선, 생산 하락 / C 생산 유지, 불만 누적
items.second_order: A 규칙 기반 운영 문화 / B 보수적 운영 고착 / C 리뷰·이직 위험

items.title: Front-Back 갈등 중재
items.situation: Front는 'Back이 느리다', Back은 'Front가 무리하게 잡는다'고 말하며 팀 분위기가 거칠어짐.
items.constraint: 피크타임 인력 추가 불가 / 회의 시간 제한
items.first_order: A 긴장 완화, 기준 생김 / B 단기 통제, 반발 / C 단기 편함, 장기 악화
items.second_order: A 상호 기준 문화 / B 파벌화 / C 이직·품질 저하

items.title: 리뷰 대응 표준화
items.situation: 부정 리뷰가 생길 때마다 대응이 제각각이라 리스크가 커진다.
items.constraint: HIPAA 준수 필요 / 공개 댓글은 환자 정보 언급 금지

options.label: 공개 댓글 템플릿 + 비공개 연락 2단계 표준화

items.first_order: A 리스크 낮고 일관성↑ / B 감정 싸움 위험 / C 평판 방치
items.second_order: A 브랜드 관리 문화 / B 온라인 갈등 확산 / C 장기 평판 손실

items.title: 결제 플랜 연체 증가
items.situation: 결제 플랜 오해로 연체와 항의가 늘어났다.
items.constraint: 정책 변경은 본사 승인 필요 / 설명 시간은 제한적
items.first_order: A 오해 감소 / B 단기 만족, 연체↑ / C 불만↑
items.second_order: A 투명·일관 문화 / B 규정 붕괴 / C 관계 악화

items.title: 소모품 재고로 인한 진료 지연
items.situation: 소모품 부족으로 케이스가 지연되고 긴급 주문이 반복된다.
items.constraint: 예산 제한 / 공급 리드타임 존재
items.first_order: A 안정 / B 긴급 비용↑ / C 임시 해결
items.second_order: A 예방 문화 / B 비효율 고착 / C 조직 피로

items.title: 환자 흐름(체어턴) 병목
items.situation: 체어턴이 느려져 하루 스케줄이 자주 밀린다.
items.constraint: 닥터 시간 고정 / 추가 체어 불가

options.label: 병목 지점을 1일 관찰 후 1개만 개선(예: tray 준비)

items.first_order: A 실행 가능 / B 혼란 / C 반발·번아웃
items.second_order: A 지속 개선 문화 / B 피로 누적 / C 두려움 문화

items.title: 신규 직원 온보딩 실패
items.situation: 신규 직원이 2주째 실수가 반복되고 본인은 위축되어 있다.
items.constraint: 교육 시간 제한 / 현장 속도 요구
items.first_order: A 안정·학습↑ / B 단기 긴장 / C 방치
items.second_order: A 교육 문화 / B 이직·위축 / C 품질 저하

items.title: 환자 컴플레인 증가: 원인 분리
items.situation: 컴플레인이 늘었지만 원인이 대기/비용/설명 중 무엇인지 혼재되어 있다.
items.constraint: 데이터가 분산 / 바쁜 운영
items.first_order: A 원인 명확화 / B 단기 진화, 재발 / C 악화
items.second_order: A 데이터 기반 개선 / B 소방 문화 / C 평판·이직 리스크

items.title: 팀 내 피드백 방식 충돌
items.situation: 공개 피드백이 반복되며 팀이 위축되고 이직 이야기가 나온다.
items.constraint: 즉시 수정이 필요한 상황도 존재
items.first_order: A 분위기 안정 / B 긴장↑ / C 품질↓
items.second_order: A 심리적 안전+품질 균형 / B 두려움 문화 / C 기준 붕괴

items.title: SSO 파일 누락 재발
items.situation: 클레임에 필요한 파일 누락이 반복되어 재작업이 늘어난다.
items.constraint: 업로드 규칙 복잡 / 최종 확인자 불명확

options.label: 업로드 완료 체크의 단일 책임자 지정

items.first_order: A 누락 감소 / B 반복 / C 분위기 악화
items.second_order: A 책임 명확화 문화 / B 시스템 불안정 / C 방어 문화

items.title: 하루 마감(End-of-day) 누락
items.situation: 하루 마감 체크가 누락되어 다음날 혼란이 발생한다.
items.constraint: 야근 최소화 필요 / 체크 항목이 많음
items.first_order: A 준수율↑ / B 누락 지속 / C 반발
items.second_order: A 실행 가능한 표준화 / B 소방 반복 / C 두려움 문화

items.title: 예약 공백 증가(생산 손실)
items.situation: 예약 공백이 늘어 생산 손실이 체감된다.
items.constraint: 마케팅 예산 추가 불가 / 급작스런 프로모션 제한

options.label: 당일 공백 리스트를 만들어 대기환자 연락 프로세스 고정

items.first_order: A 회복 가능 / B 손실 지속 / C 단기 채움, 기대치 문제
items.second_order: A 능동 운영 문화 / B 무기력 문화 / C 가격 왜곡

items.title: 현장-원격(SSO) 협업 회의 설계
